    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create()
        The create() method is an overridden method that is used to instantiate and give values to all of the variables. Create() is called every time the application is run. The create() method also sets the cursor to remain within the window and be non visible with a built in GDX method setCursorCatched (). Two for loops are used to transfer the 2D array of TextureRegion to a 1D array of TextureRegion for animation.

      • resize

        public void show()

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        The render() method is an overridden method from the GDX library. The render method is run every frame, and as a result, updates the screen every frame with new information. This allows for animations of sprites and such to be easier. Things are displayed on the screen using a SpriteBatch, which acts as a container of sorts for the screen elements.Various for loops are used to detect user input, as for collision and detection.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Unused overridden method.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
